meanings.definition: Divide or organize (an area) into new political districts.
meanings.sent1: The government redistricts the city to ensure fair representation.
meanings.sent2: Every ten years, the state redistricts based on population changes.
meanings.sent3: The mayor redistricts the town, causing confusion among the residents.
meanings.sent4: The teacher redistricts the classroom seating arrangement for better group work.
meanings.sent5: The company redistricts its departments to improve efficiency.

meanings.definition: The action of dividing or organizing an area into new political districts.
meanings.sent1: After the redistricts, the election results changed significantly.
meanings.sent2: The redistricts led to a more balanced representation in the government.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected redistricts caused a stir among the local politicians.
meanings.sent4: The redistricts brought about a sense of community among the residents.
meanings.sent5: The redistricts resulted in a fairer distribution of resources.
